newsitem.title: DUBAI: Haj generated 47,000 tonnes of waste - Mecca mayor.
newsitem.headline: Haj generated 47,000 tonnes of waste - Mecca mayor.

text.p: Some 47,400 tonnes of rubbish were cleared from the Islamic holy city of Mecca and surrounding areas following last week's haj pilgrimage, Mecca's Mayor Omar Abdullah Qadi said in comments published on Thursday.
This was 31 percent more than the amount collected after last year's pilgrimage, the English-language Saudi daily Arab News quoted the mayor as adding.
Some two million Moslems, half of the from abroad, performed this year's haj -- about the same number as last year.
